data.title: Slow by big sushi
data.text: Great sushi nice and thick and very fresh. Many different options as well. Would go again but the table service was slow. Great place for take out

data.title: Traditional Thai from mild to spicy as you like, and plentiful
data.text: This was a takeout order and was ready in the time they stated. The Tom Cha Gai soup was delicious - tangy and spicy. They offer many different combinations (chicken, shrimp, tofu) in their Tom... soups. The mango curry and white rice was also very good, enough for 2 meals. The traditional pad Thai could have been prepared better as the noodles were packed rather tightly and the shrimp was overcooked. Also, more than enough quantity for two people. Although the you are paying for the amount of food in the total price.

data.title: Excellent and reliable Thai
data.text: Baan Thai is our reliable take-out whenever we want something delicious and comforting. Duck green curry and Siamese eggplant are our stand-bys, and I adore the black rice pudding dessert. The restaurant itself is OK but lacking in atmosphere, so we end up doing take-out most of the time.

data.title: Ignored by Servers on a Slow Friday Night
data.text:
There were 6 non-active tables in this small, dull, Asian/Sushi restaurant on a Friday evening.

I watched the server who was supposed to wait on us repetitiously: answer phone calls, clean already clean tables, go to the back several times, talk to staff, and look at her phone, and continue to completely ignore me and my mother for about 10 minutes.

When it was clear that she didn't want to wait on us, we proceeded to leave. That's when she sarcastically asked us if we wanted anything. I asked her why did she wait until we were leaving to ask if we wanted anything. She didn't have an answer. 

I was warned about the racism I would encounter in Boston as an African-American. After visiting numerous restaurants, it is apparent that some people forget how green my money is, despite the color of the hand that gives it to them. They lost the support of a local lover of Asian-cuisine.

data.title: Nearly 5*, best Thai for miles around
data.text:
I have not had better Thai *food* in this area of Massachusetts than at Baan Thai. Notice the stress on the word food.

We've been twice, once as a couple and once as a family. Parking is on the street for about 5-6 cars up to 2 hours or there is a paid public car park behind the restaurant.

The decor is so so and tired, not very upmarket. Server is a lady, who is the one who seats and takes orders and serves food. There is an elderly gentleman who is also always around who helps a little. All the dishes we ordered when we went for lunch (once) and dinner (once) were great, no exceptions. We are discerning Thai eaters, so take our word for it and try it.

The downside is that the server is loath to engage or smile and that wouldn't be so bad if that were the character, but they clearly have a great time with the aforementioned staff, laughing and giggling away when not serving anyone, in the corner. So the dour front is for the customers only, it seems! The place is not as busy as it should be, I am sure the frontage of the restaurant, the decor and the customer service are to blame, because the food certainly isn't. We ordered everything from vegetarian to shrimp to chicken to soups and sushi and it was all good, so clearly the kitchen staff is great.

Docked the one star for the above issues, else we will be returning again for Thai food, which is the best we've had so far in Massachusetts.

data.title: Good Food Good Service
data.text: I have frequented dozens of Thai restaurants as we typically enjoy Thai food.  The food here was very tasty & well prepared, however, I think the portion sizes are less than generous.  The dumplings for example are very small & there are not many in the appetizer order.  Otherwise, I found the owner to be both present & pleasant and the wait staff attentive and efficient.

data.title: Excellent Food
data.text:
I had the crispy pad thai and I must say it was the best I have eaten anywhere.  My wife had the siamese eggplant and it too was fantastic.  The dinners were a great value at $11.95.  We also had the steamed dumpling appetizer, which was also very good but they were on the small side and we thought a bit overpriced at $5.95. This is the first time we have had dinner at the restaurant but I assume the rest of the food is equally good.

The service was good as well.  We were served right away and the food came out quickly.  The restaurant is nicely decorated and has a casual atmosphere.  If you are coming here for the first time you should be aware that parking in front is limited; however, just around the corner (right at the light) is a huge municipal parking lot that is free after 6pm.

I would highly recommend this restaurant, not only for the great food, but as a resident of Waltham I know they also support the community.  For some reason we had never gone there before but we will be back.

data.title: Clean, fast, wonderful food
data.text: A great little place with wonderful Thai food.  Quite reasonable for lunch.  The service is attentive and everything is fresh.

data.title: Excellent sushi and service, plus GF options
data.text: Tried Baan Thai for the first time in February and was incredibly impressed. For a restaurant that boasts a very large menu, the meals were delicately prepared with nuanced flavors and huge portions. As a gluten-free and vegan diner, there were also lots of options (a nice perk). Service was also quite good. Lighting is a bit bright - I wouldn't call it romantic - but the food made up for the lack of ambiance.

data.title: Authentic Thai Food
data.text: I've been coming here for over 6 years and I've always had great meals here. Compared to other Thai restaurants in Waltham, this is probably the most authentic, from their noodle dishes (i.e., Pad Thai and Pad See Ew), Siamese Eggplant, to any of their curry dishes.  Their prices are within the range of other ethnic restaurants in the area but I would choose this place over the others nearby.  They are also very kid friendly.

data.title: Just average
data.text: Baan Thai is conveniently located on Main Street, more or less across from City Hall. It offers decent Thai food as well as sushi in a pleasant setting, with good service. The menu is extensive, portions are good-sized, and the prices are reasonable. We came at lunch and had several dishes, all of which were pretty good but bland - even when marked with chili peppers. This is not what I'm expecting or looking for in Thai food. In Waltham, Tree Tops is better Thai, and Tom Can Cook has interesting Asian fusion.

data.title: Great Thai
data.text: We stopped here without knowing anything about the restaurant - just passing through the area and were in the mood for Thai. It was very good! The lunch specials give you so much food for a reasonable price. Soup was great. Entrees were very good too. Restaurant was almost empty when we were there (a bit on the late side) so it was a very relaxing meal. We'll definitely be back!

data.title: Absolutely DELICIOUS!!!
data.text:
I was visiting from South Carolina and was up to try something different. That was Saturday night and all the places was full including Baan Thai. Very quickly they find as a table for four.
We all order different meals but every one was delicious. Service was outstanding. Prices very reasonable and the most important qualify of the food outstanding.

data.title: Excellent Thai Food
data.text: Baan Thai is one of our favorite Thai restaurants in the area.  The prices are reasonable, quality of the food is superb, and the service is excellent.  The crispy pad thai is out of this world delicious.

data.title: Good food. Good Value.
data.text:
We get delivery from Baan Thai at least once a week.
The Sushi is fantastic.  The Thai is wonderful.
Ussually fast and friendly delivery service.
Dining in is a joy also.  Excellent luncheon plates to offer.  
Brought a clent in who had lived in Thailand for a while and he found something on the menu he had not seen since returning.  I was not surprised.

data.title: Value Meal
data.text: I've been to this restaurant a few times but only found out about their lunch boxes this time around. For $12 you get an entre choice, a salad, 2 fried dumplings, 2 spring rolls, rice, a Tom Yum soup, and fried bananas for dessert. It's worth every penny.

data.title: Very fresh, something for everyone (who likes Thai food)
data.text: I'm in love with Ban Thai's duck green curry.  Generous portions, beautiful plate presentation.  Cholly wants to make sure you're happy.

data.title: Good Value, Good Food, Good Service
data.text: We stopped in during the Steampunk festival going on across the street.  The food was good.  The service was good. The price was good.  We would definitely go back again.

data.title: Tasty but too stingy
data.text: My business partner and I had lunch here last week. While our dishes were tasty (spicy noodle soup & vegetarian curry) the content just wasn't there.

data.title: Best Kept Secret
data.text: This is quite the gem in Waltham! The food is authentic and the service is delightful! Will definitely be back.
